title: Military healthcare professional gets unjustly denied leave, uses his medical expertise to still get a paid day off: ‘We’ll see who wins this game’
description: Remember when you were little and you would fake sick to get out of going to school? You would sneak a heating pad on your forehead, or put it close to your lamp. You'd wail and moan about your stomach hurting. You'd fake some coughing and sneezing. And maybe if you were really good, you'd fake some upchucking. It was truly an art form. It's always been looked down upon from your educators, parents, and other authority figures. But little did they know, you could use that talent when you got older—especially, if you went into the medical field.  You can see faking sick as a kid coming in handy with this Reddit thread! A healthcare professional who worked for the military did some medical work on the side, which was totally acceptable. He would submit leave and take a day to get some extra cash. Smart, really. However, this time he had a new first sergeant that didn't like his "moonlighting" work. So when he submitted to get a day of leave so he could go make some good money, he was denied. Unjustly, according to him! So, instead of taking the L, he put his medical expertise to work…
author: Elna McHilderson
excerpt: Military healthcare professional gets unjustly denied leave, uses his medical expertise to still get a paid day off: ‘We’ll see who wins this game’ - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
